channel.title: PINGcast rss feed
channel.description: PINGS springs directly from the geographical distance between two collaborators. Working directly from their locales they explore the physical space between them through rivers and air and a range of other terrains with their own qualities, such as the web, phone, post, and the less tangible links of memory and synchronicity. In January 2008 the artists began an exchange of performance and materials through these various channels as a means of mapping these terrains.mp4ement artist Simon Whitehead and Sound artist Barnaby Oliver have been working simultaneously from their local rivers in Abercych, west Wales and Melbourne, Australia. Although a few thousand miles apart they share the intention to meet at a particular time each week and approach their rivers as an unbroken body of water through which they correspond. Their instincts are improvisational and over time they have been building a body of performative material from these shared events. Linked by their shared intentions and the physical rivers this material (in video, sound and image) begins to create its own character responsive to season, the time of day, the level of water and the meandering presence of each artist. This unedited material is shared through the net and snail mail and the artists now invite you to subscribe to these events through podcast, email and post. See www.untitledstates.net/pings for more information. Barnaby Oliver and Simon Whitehead have been collaborating for over 12 years. Their online resource www.untitledstates.net elaborates on their work, past and present. PINGS is funded by an Artsadmin (London) Roaming Bursary.

item.title: Ping 71: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Wed, 07 Jan 2009 20:57:49 +0000
item.description: minus 10

item.title: Ping 70: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Tue, 30 Dec 2008 15:28:09 +0000
item.description: 30 December. 11am. Riverbank.

item.title: Ping 69: maribyrnong west bank (barnaby oliver) - Mon, 15 Dec 2008 10:41:37 +0000
item.description: wet and chilly sat on bench. amp failing - battery? unaccountable melancholy.

item.title: Ping 68: dulais (simon whitehead) - Sun, 14 Dec 2008 13:01:24 +0000
item.description: mist, full river, cows huddled around hay, drag guitar across hoar frost field to the river

item.title: Ping 67: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Wed, 10 Dec 2008 12:20:39 +0000
item.description: Drawing birds in the rain

item.title: Ping 66: maribyrnong east bank (barnaby oliver) - Mon, 08 Dec 2008 07:43:44 +0000
item.description: HEavenly Queen

item.title: Ping 65: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Wed, 26 Nov 2008 11:45:02 +0000
item.description:
dead fox and robin on road to river,
i sit on the bank with microphones in my ears listening to river through small fender amp

item.title: Ping 64: maribyrnong east bank, under railway bridge (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 23 Nov 2008 02:51:32 +0000
item.description: gusting wind, hard to get a recording of anything much. try sheltering microphones in mouth.

item.title: Ping 63: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Fri, 21 Nov 2008 13:46:12 +0000
item.description:
cow parsley stems and beech leaves,
a trumpet for listening.....

item.title: Ping 62: maribyrnong east bank (barnaby oliver) - Mon, 03 Nov 2008 22:22:57 +0000
item.description: grey spring afternoon. only colour is in patches of nameless purple flowers.

item.title: Ping 61: dulais (simon whitehead) - Mon, 03 Nov 2008 20:42:59 +0000
item.description: a goldfish bowl? no, a washing up bowl

item.title: Ping 60: maribyrnong west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 19 Oct 2008 10:33:13 +0100
item.description: Ruben's ping

item.title: Ping 59: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Wed, 15 Oct 2008 19:25:07 +0100
item.description: unplugged guitar under a large oak, acorns dropping

item.title: Ping 57: maribyrnong west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 05 Oct 2008 04:44:59 +0100
Ping 56: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Fri, 26 Sep 2008 16:42:16 +0100
item.description: WALTER GREGORY'S ETHELYNE FLUID FOR CATTLE

item.title: Ping 55: maribyrnong west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 21 Sep 2008 04:36:49 +0100
item.description: no car today. strapped guitar to child seat of bike and rode along river bank. part 1 - high gain, on bike path. part 2 - low gain, on rough ground.

item.title: Ping 54: dulais (simon whitehead) - Tue, 16 Sep 2008 13:49:45 +0100
item.description:
hawberries, blackberries, rowan berries, acorns, hazel nuts, crab apples and me falling on the road to the river
pick them up, pick me up..

item.title: Ping 53: dulais (simon whitehead) - Fri, 05 Sep 2008 18:12:25 +0100
item.description: early floods sometimes the water rises up around you and your country literally disappears beneath your feet.

item.title: Ping 52: Dulais. 26 Aug (simon whitehead) - Tue, 26 Aug 2008 15:38:34 +0100
item.description: tethering leaves to the riverbed, eventually the stones are dislodged by the current and the leaves syncopate free...

item.title: Ping 51: maribyrnong west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 24 Aug 2008 09:14:23 +0100
item.description: I often wondered what was at the bottom of the river. Then I heard the police were dredging and estimated 120 cars had been dumped in this stretch over the years. I found 2 of them.

item.title: Ping 50: Dulais (simon whitehead) - Sun, 10 Aug 2008 21:49:06 +0100
item.description:
arrive at the river with a piece of copper pipe and a story i wrote for a young friend who has had a hard time recently. speak the story through the pipe into the river.
the river is high and fast today.

item.title: Ping 49: maribyrnong west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 10 Aug 2008 08:24:21 +0100
item.description: experiments with home-made contact mics: 1) on wire fence along riverbank, 2) on branch of nearby bush. Icy wind and warm sun.

item.title: Ping 48: dulais (simon whitehead) - Tue, 29 Jul 2008 09:09:16 +0100
item.description: hot day, stand in the river up to my waist, light is reflecting into and from the water onto leaves and tree trunks. i try to strum the guitar in time with the flickering light

item.title: Ping 47: maribyrnong east bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 20 Jul 2008 05:52:27 +0100
item.description: ... walk back to car, a little deflated.

item.title: Ping 46: maribyrnong east bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 20 Jul 2008 05:41:14 +0100
item.description: stopped by humming sound coming from cement works. played along, until battery runs out (again!)...

item.title: Ping 45: dulais. 18 july (simon whitehead) - Sat, 19 Jul 2008 18:45:55 +0100
item.description:
wade the river barefoot with jennifer monson, come to a place in the river and she begins to reflect sound off the water with her mouth, i join in, we converse with the river.
my nose in the water, i see young trout passing by..

item.title: Ping 44: dulais. 8 july (simon whitehead) - Tue, 08 Jul 2008 17:13:24 +0100
item.description: theres the smell of water mint on the riverbank, take off my shoes, dig a hole in riverbed, put my head in it.

item.title: Ping 43: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Mon, 07 Jul 2008 06:47:25 +0100
item.description: chilly and unsettled, walking the river's edge. draw man with guitar in the earth with a stone from the old railway track.

item.title: Ping 42: dulais. 2 july (simon whitehead) - Wed, 02 Jul 2008 17:19:56 +0100
item.description: in the forest, each time a bird sings i take a hazel leaf and 'pop' it in my hand, the bird leaves of course..

item.title: Ping 41: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Thu, 19 Jun 2008 12:55:03 +0100
item.description: sometimes I come with an empty head, but occasionally i come with a lot of purpose. tonight i had a clear aim - to get up high, to get to the footbridge and stand in the middle. I get there and stop, then dangle my microphones over the side, letting them dance in the wind.

item.title: Ping 40: DULAIS. 19 June (simon whitehead) - Thu, 19 Jun 2008 11:38:15 +0100
item.description: Approach a field of cows by the river, speak to them(badly), sit amongst them and nuzzle

item.title: Ping 39: dulais. 10 june (simon whitehead) - Tue, 10 Jun 2008 20:48:30 +0100
item.description:
my first walk to the river in 2 weeks.. ive been somewhere else.
i arrive at the river and lie on the bank facing the sun, feet in the water. eventually i see what appears to be a brown trout rise out of the water and stare at me and float down the bank in mid air..no jest! i then see that the trout's head is in the mouth of a mink, black, it is camouflaged by the shade of the bank. it walks slowly carrying the trout as big as itself until it disappears into a patch of nettles.
i lie with this image and sing a song..

item.title: Ping 38: maribyrnong, west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 01 Jun 2008 12:16:28 +0100
item.description: Clear day. Walking backwards to the water, pulling guitar.

item.title: Ping 37: maribyrnong, west bank (barnaby oliver) - Sun, 25 May 2008 12:03:07 +0100
item.description: Lonely dog. Sympathetic guitar.

item.title: Ping 36: Dulais. 14 May (simon whitehead) - Sun, 18 May 2008 22:20:37 +0100
item.description: late afternoon on the riverbank, sit facing the sun, energy low, fighter planes pass over, make a reed out of grass, blow, later buzzards call back

item.title: Ping 35: Dulais. 11 May. 7am (simon whitehead) - Sun, 11 May 2008 08:36:30 +0100
item.description: wake to radio news of aftermath in Burma stand in forest, close my eyes, hold a white stick and walk to the river balancing a tin drum on my head

item.title: Ping 34: Stoney Creek (barnaby oliver) - Sat, 10 May 2008 08:09:43 +0100
item.description: Not much to say today. sat quietly with the rabbits under the westgate bridge.

item.title: Ping 33: Maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Sat, 03 May 2008 12:28:42 +0100
item.description: walked along the bank the usual way, off into 'waste' ground and building site. stopped at concrete tunnel under railway. felt good to sing.

item.title: Ping 32: Dulais. 30 April (simon whitehead) - Wed, 30 Apr 2008 14:42:38 +0100
item.description: sit in a clearing listening to birdsong, trees are being felled nearby. there are fallen trees at my feet, tie guitar to top of tree with its lead and raise the tree to vertical the guitar waves like a flag before it falls again

item.title: Ping 31: maribyrnong, west bank (barnaby oliver) - Fri, 25 Apr 2008 12:41:00 +0100
item.description: Been carrying these pheasant feathers around for weeks now...

item.title: Ping 30: Dulais. 23 April (simon whitehead) - Wed, 23 Apr 2008 15:19:58 +0100
item.description: Riverbank marigolds opening in the sun playing guitar with the undergrowth

item.title: Ping 29: maribyrnong (west bank) (barnaby oliver) - Fri, 18 Apr 2008 04:51:56 +0100
item.description: Who comes to the river at night? dog-tired, i prop the guitar in a tree, sit quietly beneath and listen to the leaves playing. (to be able to play with such sensitivity!)

item.title: Ping 28: Dulais. 16 April (simon whitehead) - Wed, 16 Apr 2008 15:15:50 +0100
item.description:
six bottles a guitar and a branch in the river,
a man appears (a rare occurence here), named Graeme he is visiting the river forty years to the day that he left it. he fished here, caught sewin and trout, he swam and walked it with friends and as he speaks i see he is back there, forty years ago. he is full of reverie and it is infectious, as he leaves he gestures to the guitar and bottles, an incline of the head is all thats needed..

item.title: Ping 27: Dulais. 9 April (simon whitehead) - Thu, 10 Apr 2008 13:10:19 +0100
item.description: hail rain stones and sticks

item.title: Ping 26: maribyrnong, west bank (barnaby oliver) - Mon, 07 Apr 2008 13:27:19 +0100
item.description:
saturday afternoon is a lot more lively - people fishing and cycling. i meet 2 small boys - one plays his harmonica for me and they ask if i'll play my guitar. i decline but immediately regret it.
instead i find a quiet spot to sit amongst fallen leaves and seed pods.

item.title: Ping 25: Dulais . 2 April (simon whitehead) - Fri, 04 Apr 2008 19:47:35 +0100
item.description:
just walking the riverbanks, occasionally crossing the river..
watching a large branch becoming caught in the bank, counter to the flow it creates turbulence in itself and the water around it. It remains in this state of balanced tension, oscillating beautifully.
It is stuck, but it seems that this is a transitory state, a balance, the branch is likely to become untethered at any moment..

item.title: Ping 24: maribyrnong, east bank (barnaby oliver) - Sat, 29 Mar 2008 05:48:39 +0000
item.description:
under railway bridge between footscray and kensington. damp chill.
made a boat from 2 pieces of wood and watched it meander downstream. does everything end up in the sea eventually?

item.title: Ping 23: dulais (simon whitehead) - Fri, 28 Mar 2008 13:10:43 +0000
item.description:
listen to spring birdsong river high and muddy wood anemone wood pecker
tie guitar to dead tree with cable and drag along the forest floor..

item.title: Ping 22: Abercych (simon whitehead) - Fri, 21 Mar 2008 00:50:39 +0000
item.description:
drag guitar thro hawthorn bushes by river,
throw guitar in river, it floats 200m. downstream, retrieve, fall in, walk home..

item.title: Ping 21: Maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Fri, 21 Mar 2008 00:42:53 +0000
item.description: Just sitting and listening. Moon almost full: is it the same everywhere?

item.title: Ping 19: Stoney Creek, Yarraville (barnaby oliver) - Thu, 13 Mar 2008 09:07:20 +0000
item.description: footbridge, stoney creek backwash. Talking to gulls and pelicans

item.title: Ping 18: abercych (simon whitehead) - Thu, 13 Mar 2008 04:23:26 +0000
item.description:
cold wind today, river in spate, 2 men planting trees along the riverside.
walking through conifer forest i pluck the dead, horizontal branches as i pass.

item.title: Ping 17: abercych (simon whitehead) - Fri, 29 Feb 2008 14:12:28 +0000
item.description: (part 2)

item.title: Ping 16: abercych (simon whitehead) - Fri, 29 Feb 2008 13:21:32 +0000
item.description:
11 am
approach the river, the smell of fox again, a woodpecker in a tree.
water low, calm, green wade to the eddies by the big meander, balance the guitar in the ash tree, rest the neck on the riverbed. the water plays the strings, there are different surges and frequencies in the volume of water.
i approach the guitar through the water, the turbulence i create changes the sound. i play the copper pipe into the water close to the machine heads, the strings pick up the vibration.
i have borrowed my friend Ade's waders, when i enter the river i feel the strange weight of the water compress me and the way i move is in relation to the volume and movement of water around me ..unstable, like dancing before i can walk...

item.title: Ping 15: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Thu, 28 Feb 2008 10:43:28 +0000
item.description: Cold wind i draw in the dust with guitar then strum quietly

item.title: Ping 14: abercych (simon whitehead) - Wed, 20 Feb 2008 10:55:00 +0000
item.description:
strong smell of fox, a newly killed pheasant, river low and green, the rooks are beginning to nest, misty blue day
catkins, guitar perched in a hazel branch over the river, breeze cradles it

item.title: Ping 12: abercych (simon whitehead) - Sun, 17 Feb 2008 09:10:23 +0000
item.description: indoors, flu, aching limbs, outside ice and sun,

item.title: Ping 11: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Fri, 15 Feb 2008 11:13:02 +0000
item.description: (9.28pm)Just listening... (10.09pm)Under railway bridge catching wind in guitar strings. Bats and rats

item.title: Ping 10: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Thu, 07 Feb 2008 10:13:02 +0000
item.description: (8.52pm)preparing to put guitar in river... (9.20pm)Guitar drying i sit and play harmonica figure standing on opposite bank i wonder what he's doing i see starfish

item.title: Ping 9: abercych (simon whitehead) - Thu, 07 Feb 2008 09:41:00 +0000
item.description: 9.38am bend in the river strong current today play with copper tube walk home in sunlight

item.title: Ping 7: abercych (simon whitehead) - Thu, 31 Jan 2008 07:04:55 +0000
item.description: 2 buzzards, low morning sun, frost, cold feet and a sheet of steel

item.title: Ping 6: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Wed, 30 Jan 2008 10:18:55 +0000
item.description: walking along railway track to bridge. start to play harmonica. recorder battery runs out. continue playing and humming in the dark, trucks overhead.

item.title: Ping 5: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Wed, 23 Jan 2008 10:11:00 +0000
item.description: At the mouth of stoney creek. low tide mud. drop leaves on guitar til battery flat and sun down

item.title: Ping 4: abercych (simon whitehead) - Wed, 23 Jan 2008 09:32:36 +0000
item.description: Starlings 2 young fox lizard on road cormorant fishing wade barefoot fall in

item.title: Ping 2: maribyrnong (barnaby oliver) - Thu, 17 Jan 2008 11:23:00 +0000
item.description: (10.23pm) Searching for a place. Saw lone rabbit. Bird call echoed off shipping containers. Wind blowing waves inland. Threw a stone.

item.title: Ping 1: abercych (simon whitehead) - Thu, 17 Jan 2008 09:48:00 +0000
item.description: The river is swollen leaves washed off the path by rain new shoots have grown beneath
